review: What can I say that others haven't?  I cut the cord a few years back, using an Apple TV.  Later I got one of these for a second tv, and a little later I bought another one and gave my daughter the Apple TV.The biggest difference between this and the Apple TV (Ignoring the voice search, which is gimmicky in my opinion), is that unlike the Apple TV, the Amazon Fire TV has it's own subscribe-able premium content that comes with Prime membership.  If you're a Prime member, you'd be foolish to go with anything that doesn't offer Amazon Prime content.  I think Apple TV is the only device out there that doesn't.Very snappy UI also.  This seems minor, but for anyone who's used anything else with a laggy UI, it becomes a bigger and bigger issue each day.

review: We have had nothing but problems with the Amazon Fire TV! I would recommend the Roku. We love our Roku but wanted to try the Amazon Fire Tv for our bedroom. Bad choice. It always freezes, very slow to load, always have problems with movies that we pay money for (Amazon has been wonderful with giving our money back for these movies atleast thank you). The visual and look of this product is very slick and nice. But the quality is terrible. Again I recommend the Roku. Have never had a problem with it.
